intro: Notylia xiphophorus, commonly known as the red-stemmed flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Linaceae and is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Notylia xiphophorus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a border plant.
